name: redis-cli
body:
### Common Usage

```
redis-cli -h endpoint -p port
```

### Examples
```
redis-cli -h production-replica.asbzmi.3104.usw1.cache.amazonaws.com -p 6379  
```

```
redis-cli -h 127.0.0.1 -p 6379  
```  


### Defaults

- localhost `127.0.0.1`
- port `6379`
- no password

### Common Flags
- `-a`    password
- `-v`    version
- `-h`    help

### Install

```
apt-get install redis-server
```
Or the current stable version (as of 8-29-14):

http://download.redis.io/releases/redis-2.8.13.tar.gz
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
